I've used Borderless Gaming on and off for years now. I had stopped using it for a while after getting an ultrawide monitor as I didn't want to run games in full screen as frequently, opting for another, older program that allowed me to borderless window games in set positions. With the 1.0 release of Borderless Gaming, I was finally able to uninstall that archaic feeling and looking piece of software as everything I need is here. From setting specific window sizes to offsetting the window down to the pixel, hiding taskbar to keeping the cursor bound to the game. It's all here in a nice little, easy to use package.

I couldn't recommend this program enough and the only reason my "hours used" in Steam is so low is because I run it through the EXE so it doesn't clog my Steam activity. Well worth the money spent.

Love the new look. It's easy to understand and works the way It should. I use Borderless Gaming to play in ultrawide without using Nvidia Surround. I retain my HDR and high refresh rate as well. I'll set the game to windowed mode, set the window size to custom, and set my resolution to 7678 x 1440p. There's an easy drag option to set it up across the three monitors. 

I'll list a few games that I found worked well using this method. Rocket League, Star Wars Squadrons, Disco Elysium, Dragon Age Veilguard, Oblivion Remastered, and SWOTOR. My setup is 32:9 aspect ratio when using all three monitors as one, and most games only support 21:9 at most so I'll sometimes see stuff I'm not supposed to lol. 

Disco Elisium for example you can see the UI assets tucked away on the sides that should be hidden if only using 16:9 to 21:9 haha.  Or Dragon Age Veilguard, when you're in the dream like section, The dream filter only extends to 21:9 lol. So I can see the rectangle filter stop half way and each side of my left and right monitors lol.

Anyways great software, it allows me to play some games in ultrawide without going through the tedious process of disabling DSC on my monitors and enabling Nvidia Surround. Which locks all three monitors to 120hz with no HDR. I highly recommend.
